nitf_Record* nitf_Record_clone (  nitf_Record *  source,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Clone this object. This is a deep copy operation.

Parameters:
source The source object
error An error to populate upon failure
Returns:
A new object that is identical to the old

nitf_Record* nitf_Record_construct (  nitf_Version  version,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Create a new record. This allocates the Record itself, its FileHeader, and inits all of the Lists of segments to be empty. It NULL-sets everything else. The FVER (fileVersion) field of the FileHeader is also set, based on the version specified. If an invalid version is specified, NITF_VER_21 is assumed, creating a NITF 2.1 record.

If an error should occur, the function will return NULL, and the error object will be populated

Parameters:
version The nitf_Version of the Record
error An error to populate if a problem occurs
Returns:
A record to return

void nitf_Record_destruct (  nitf_Record **  record  ) 
 

Destroy a record and NULL-set it

Parameters:
record A record to destroy

nitf_Version nitf_Record_getVersion (  nitf_Record *  record,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Returns the nitf_Version enum for the Record in the Reader

Parameters:
record the Record object
error The error to populate on failure
Returns:
nitf_Version enum specifying the version

NITF_BOOL nitf_Record_moveDataExtensionSegment (  nitf_Record *  record,
nitf_Uint32  oldIndex,
nitf_Uint32  newIndex,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

This moves the segment from the oldIndex to the newIndex. This is a shortcut for: nitf_List_move(record->dataExtensions, oldIndex, newIndex, error);

Parameters:
oldIndex the index of the segment to move
newIndex the index where the segment will be moved to
Exceptions:
NITFException

nitf_DESegment* nitf_Record_newDataExtensionSegment (  nitf_Record *  record,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

Creates and returns a new DESegment* that is bound to the Record

Note: The accompanying ComponentInfo object for this segment is also created and added to the FileHeader structure for it

Parameters:
record the Record object
error The error to populate on failure
Returns:
nitf_DESegment* that is bound to the Record

NITF_BOOL nitf_Record_removeDataExtensionSegment (  nitf_Record *  record,
nitf_Uint32  segmentNumber,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

This removes the segment at the given offset. The segment is de-allocated, and removed from the system.

CAUTION!!! -- Removing a segment removes the memory in the segment list, so any usage of the segment will cause a segmentation fault.

Parameters:
segmentNumber 
Exceptions:
NITFException
